repnme.cdata!: Indonesia - Domestic Gas Market Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Domestic Gas Market
            Development Project for Indonesia were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, Bank performance was moderately satisfactory,
            and Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: in implementing a market reform
            project, the supervision of the project needs to pay as much
            attention to fundamental policy, regulatory, and pricing
            reforms as it does to the delivery and commissioning of
            physical infrastructure and its impacts. A positive benefit
            arising from improved confidence in the probity and
            transparency of procurement is that well qualified, genuine
            bidders will be more likely to submit proposals, thereby
            increasing the effective level of competition for goods,
            works, and services. Careful specification of complex market
            related infrastructure, such as the supervisory control and
            data acquisition (SCADA) system, needs to take into account
            how that infrastructure will be used in the evolving market.
